title-group.article-title: The Hebrewer: A Web-based Inflection Generator

abstract.p: This paper reports on the grammatical and programmatical production aspects of the Hebrewer, a cross-platform web-based reference work in the form of a Hebrew inflection generator. The Hebrewer, a Java applet/servlet combination, is currently capable of generating 2,500 nouns in full declension and 500 verbs in full conjugation, displaying the results in vocalized Hebrew and allowing users to print the inflection charts.

The identity of the historical stem may be obscured by phonological processes which find expression in the final form. For example, some forms which have a seghol as VI and, in their inflection, point to a *qatl origin may have come from a *qitl stem (e.g., מלך 'king' and מלכי but no pausal מלך which would point to an original stem vowel [a]). Similarly, historical *qatl forms may be inflected in the *qitl pattern (כבש 'sheep'י(?בשי as does the *qutl אמר 'utterance'אמרי.

Many segholates have two parallel variants, one with a seghol and the other with a tsere in this position (e.g., הפך~הפך 'opposite,'ז?ר~זכר 'remembrance'). For analysis of the distribution of tsere and seghol in *qitl segholates, see Revell (1985).

We use here the terms "independent" and "dependent" to refer to the absolute and con- struct forms, respectively. Occurrences of dependent forms like חדר 'room' (independent חדר) or נטע. 'sapling' (independent טע?.) are rare (see discussion in Steiner 1976). A small group of segholates produce nouns of the structure cacac or cacec in both independent and dependent forms, e.g., לבש 'honey' and שכם 'shoulder,' both of the *qitl group.

If the noun has both singular and plural forms, no number is indicated and the declension defaults to both. If, however, the noun has a singular form only, we tag it as SG_PL="SG_ ONLY" (e.g., ל?ת 'going' and נגב 'south'). Similarly, a noun like כלאים' 'hybrid' is tagged as SG_PL="PL_ONLY".

Since the organizing principle is geared toward the final display, and not toward the historical origins of the nouns, the roots are tagged accordingly. Thus, מלך 'king,' which is originally a *qitl segholate, is tagged as a *qatl segholate to produce the forms with suf- fixes (מלכי, etc.).ז?ת 'tar,' which is a *qatl segholate, is tagged as a *qitl segholate to produce the forms with suffixes like זפתי, etc.
